intro: Sparattanthelium septentrionale, commonly known as the northern sparrowgrass, is a rare flowering plant native to the boreal forests of northern Europe. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of silky hairs. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in shaded, forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
